Articles.Content: ... You're watching romantic fireworks with your Significant Other, who gets annoyed with you when you start trying to figure out their Isp and TWR.
You start dreaming of KSP, and wake up the next morning knowing what to build next.
you start seeing planets in oranges

You start dreaming of KSP, and wake up the next morning knowing what to build next.

That seriously happened to me yesterday, I went to bed after watching Scott Manley's Reusable Space Program, and started dreaming about mining kethane on Eve (and for some reason I exited an aeroplane to find myself in the middle of a jungle with the newly relocated KSC, and we also had compitition in the same area)

Edited April 20, 2013 by ROFLCopter64bit
are is not the same word as area
You complain to your PE teacher about your low ISP.
My dream was about landing on Duna with a skycrane. From the perspective of the rover. It was a strange dream indeed.

My dream was about landing on Duna with a skycrane. From the perspective of the rover. It was a strange dream indeed.

My mind likes to dream in third-person, so don't feel alarmed.

"Right clicking and trying to rotate the view when looking at KSP pictures in the forum."

Please note quote/signs of addiction from old thread. I don't recall the author or the exact wording. Funny though, I do it allll the time and had a good lol when I originally I read it.

Your wife asks if everything is ok when you are NOT playing Kerbal Space Program. This is happening in my house lately!
You spend your days thinking about rocket designs, and how to overcome challenges instead of working/studying, etc

"Right clicking and trying to rotate the view when looking at KSP pictures in the forum."

I now do this with all photos on the internet.

You spend your days thinking about rocket designs, and how to overcome challenges instead of working/studying, etc

Doesn't that happen regardless if you are addicted to KSP?
When you look at your clock 1 minute, and the next 4 hours has past.

Doesn't that happen regardless if you are addicted to KSP?

Yeah, but moreso for us addicts. Maybe we need a Kerbaholics Anonymous group or something..
You rendezvous with your tanker and there is a queue...
You click "refresh" every minute to see if the KSP-Forums are up again.

You click "refresh" every minute to see if the KSP-Forums are up again.

It's part of my OCD requirements, except it's every 5 seconds.

It's part of my OCD requirements, except it's every 5 seconds.

Plot twist! You caused the slowdown because you refreshed too often!

Plot twist! You caused the slowdown because you refreshed too often!

But, but, I was refreshing because of the lag!

Someone, get me some cheez.
You get your 6yr old son loads of childrens spaceflight books from the library so you can read them to him yourself.
when its a hard choice whether to to lecture and go drinking afterwards, or to play KSP
You uncontrollably explode...
You're afraid of fast forwarding a movie in case the people on the TV go out of control and blow up.

When you see things like

commercial and think "Wow, why doesn't that lag?"
When you "throttle up" a sink.
When you're watching a little kids show and scoffing at how they are not doing gravity turns and using inefficient direct burns.
